alert.note: Alert for Mariposa (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 15 at 9:15PM PDT until further notice by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Merced River at Pohono Bridge affecting Mariposa County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Merced River...including Pohono Bridge...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Merced River at Pohono Bridge. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Western portion of North Pines Campground located at the east end of Yosemite Valley between the confluence of the Merced River and Tenaya Creek begins to flood. Water rises to the base of the swinging bridge downstream from Chapel Meadow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM PDT Monday the stage was 9.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this evening to 10.7 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning to 9.5 feet tomorrow afternoon. It will then rise above flood stage again tomorrow evening. The Merced River at Pohono Bridge will stair-step upwards through the week. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.7 feet on 06/05/1995. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1000 AM PDT.
